results.title: The Trusteeship Council and system
results.creator_credit: J.C. Sheers and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: its charter and organization”
Demonstrates the aims, structure and mechanics of the Trusteeship Council by showing the improved standard of living and eventual independence of Somaliland under the administration of Italy.

results.title: The Trout
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”
In a fast-flowing, rocky river in Yorkshire, we watch the angler casting into the areas where he suspects the trout is lying. These northern rivers of Britain produce a meaner, more hungry trout, who needs less tempting than the southern variety. Three flies are used in the wet fly technique, placed about a yard apart on the line. With the aid of an underwater camera we see the trout being played and caught.

results.title: Trout in the Karri Country
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the pleasures of trout fishing in the forest streams of south-west Western Australia. Also shows the whole process of breeding from the stripping of ova from the female, the milking of the male, the growth of the ova, the hatching and growth of the fingerlings and the final release of the young fish into farm dams and streams.

results.title: The Trouble with Archie
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about a supervisor who learns to handle an employee who is always getting into trouble showing that the supervisor is firm and that at the same time he gives the employee a sense of responsibility.

results.title: Trombone and tuba
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and music lover. Professional musicians show how the trombone and the tuba are played, demonstrate their range and tone and how to care for them.

results.title: The Trials of Zanzibar
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal, Stephen Clarke and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Reports on political trials being held in Zanzibar where the accused are refused defence counsel and the prosecution admits that some of the evidence was obtained under torture. Includes an interview with Zanzibar’s Attorney-General and Aboud Jumbe, Zanzibar’s Head of State

results.title: Training methods: training program
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “National Coaching Development Programme Level One”
Encourages coaches and potential sports coaches to consider: training for energy production; learning pace; strength development; flexibility improvement; monitoring of training; strategy; diet; skill development. Examples are given across many sports.

results.title: Train time
results.creator_credit: John Shearman, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: An account of the operation of British Railways. The integration of goods and passenger services calls for a constant review of time-tables to meet the varying local needs. A sudden demand for extra locomotives in West Cornwall may effect tin plate traffic from South Wales and fish from Scottish ports rushed to the markets potentially affects rail demands in the Midlands. Shows how coal wagons are sorted in Toton Marshalling Yard and how London’s evening rush to the suburbs is dealt with. Music composed by Edward Williams.

results.title: Topsoil
results.brief_description: Tells the story of one of America’s richest treasures - the thin layer of topsoil on which the people of America depend for most of their food, clothing and other necessities of life. Topsoil takes centuries to produce; it is one of nature’s most delicate and most precious gifts; yet it may be totally destroyed in a few years by improper farming methods. This film points out the difference between the topsoil and the less productive subsoil, and ends by showing how precious topsoil may be conserved while still being used for maximum production.
